platform_detection.reasoning: The presence of an S3 service and typical AWS VPC IP ranges strongly indicate an AWS environment.

adaptive_threshold.reasoning: The risk score distribution has moderate variance (std≈2.6) and only one extreme outlier above mean+2σ, so a 2.0 Z‑score threshold balances false positives and captures the clear high‑risk node while keeping the anomaly rate near the expected 5%.

cve_details.description: Buffer overflow in the Windows Shell allows remote code execution via specially crafted file.
A flaw in the Windows 2000 TCP/IP stack allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted packet.
Buffer overflow in the Windows Shell (Windows 95/98) that can be exploited by a malicious user to execute arbitrary code.
Buffer overflow in the Windows Shell allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted file.
Apache Struts 2.0.0 to 2.3.20.1 is vulnerable to remote code execution via OGNL injection in the struts2-velocity-plugin, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server.
Microsoft Windows 2000 Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) vulnerability that allows remote code execution via a specially crafted packet.
Buffer overflow in the Windows Shell that can be exploited by local users to gain elevated privileges.
Remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Windows 95/98/NT due to improper handling of specially crafted files.
Remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Windows 2000's Win32k component via a crafted packet.
Apache Struts 2.3.x and 2.5.x remote code execution vulnerability via OGNL injection in the struts2-velocity-plugin.
